metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6302 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The tls_decrypt_ticket function in ssl/t1_lib.c in OpenSSL before 1.1.0 does not consider the HMAC size during validation of the ticket length, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a ticket that is too short.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
